snippet: Kwame Brown, the former No. 2 official in the District of Columbia’s city government, was sentenced on Tuesday to six months of house arrest and two years of probation.
abstract: Kwame Brown, former Democratic City Council chairman in the District of Columbia, is sentenced to six months of house arrest and two years of probation for campaign finance misconduct.
lead_paragraph: Kwame Brown, the former No. 2 official in the District of Columbia’s city government, was sentenced on Tuesday to six months of house arrest and two years of probation.

headline.main: Ex-Chairman of D.C. Council Is Sentenced
headline.print_headline: Ex-Chairman Of D.C. Council Is Sentenced
